author: TNN
title: Pothencode Block Panchayat's Innovative Cancer Control Program Recognized | Thiruvananthapuram News - Times of India
text: Thiruvananthapuram: Pothencode block panchayat officials were honoured by RCC additional director Dr Sajid for organising cancer control programme â€˜First Check' within its jurisdiction. The programme is being conducted in collaboration with Regional Cancer Centre RCC as part of its comprehensive cancer control plan.The project involves organising cancer detection camps in various parts of the panchayat and ensuring follow-up examinations for those diagnosed or identified with potential cancer, facilitating timely treatment and preventing the disease from becoming severe.The camps primarily focus on the early detection of cancers in the cervix, breast, and mouth. Individuals diagnosed or identified with potential cancer during the monthly camps will be referred to RCC for specialist examinations. Over the past three years, approximately 4,000 women were screened in 33 camps conducted.The ceremony held at the RCC conference hall was presided over by Dr Kalavathi M C from the RCC community oncology department and was attended by Pothencode block panchayat president Hariprasad T R, vice president Anija K S, secretary Veena Babu, standing committee chairman R Anil Kumar, RCC community oncology department head Dr Jiji Thomas, Dr Jayakrishnan R, and deputy medical superintendents Dr Sugeeth M T and Dr Rona Joseph.
